Title: The Flame in the Flood
Genre: Action , Adventure , Indie , Early Access
Developer: The Molasses Flood
Publisher: The Molasses Flood
Release Date: Sep 24, 2015

Visit the website View update history Read related news View discussions Find Community Groups
Share Embed  

Early Access Game

Get instant access and start playing; get involved with this game as it develops.

Note: This Early Access game is not complete and may or may not change further. If you are not excited to play this game in its current state, then you should wait to see if the game progresses further in development. Learn more

What the developers have to say:

Why Early Access?

“The Flame in the Flood is a game built thanks to the support of the community via Kickstarter, and is designed to be replayable. We want to get as much feedback as possible while we finish development to make sure it's the best possible game it can be. Additionally, as a procedurally generated game, it's easy to add significant updates throughout early access, so players can come back repeatedly and see changes to the game.”

Approximately how long will this game be in Early Access?

“We expect to be in early access for around 6 months.”

How is the full version planned to differ from the Early Access version?

“The full version is expected to be a more feature rich version compared to the early access version. Our goal is to have more things for the player to do, and more art to fill the world that they are exploring.”

What is the current state of the Early Access version?

“The current version is an early beta. Most the features and gameplay are present, but there's still a lot more that we can add and polish.”

Will the game be priced differently during and after Early Access?

“Our early access pricing is the same as our launch price.”

How are you planning on involving the Community in your development process?

“We plan on participating in the steam forums, as well as using our social media accounts to receive feedback. Additionally, just by playing we'll be given valuable feedback about the game. Not every suggestion will be implemented, but feedback will help us prioritize some features, cut others, and maybe even add completely new ones we hadn't thought of.”
Read more

Recent updates View all (9)

November 3

Hot Fix v0.4.001 - tuning, audio, mac resolution fixes

We just posted a hot fix for our last update, addressing some issues players have identified.

First an important note: to fix the Mac resolution issues, we needed to nuke graphics settings, so the game will launch to windowed. You can set it back in options.

Changelist:

  • Fixed issue with missing audio on certain configurations
  • Fixed issue with Mac version having an offset screen in fullscreen
  • Fixed Bait not stacking
  • Increased Raft Schematic drop frequency
  • Fixed issue with poor mouse behavior in crafting screen
  • Fixed issue where player could become stuck if they attempted to discard the bow
  • Fixed the version number (the prior update should have been v0.4.000)

7 comments Read more

October 29

New Version Posted: v 0.3.008

Hey all,

We've just posted our first major content update since going into Early Access.

Of note: previous save games will not carry over, so you will need to start a new run if you have a save.

We've fixed a ton of bugs and added a bunch of new features. Noteworthy new features include:

Bow & Arrow - craftable bow & arrows, they can be used to hunt predators & rabbits
Wasteland Biome - A new environment to explore
Buildable Camp Fires - make fires anywhere (that's not in water)
Workbenches - finally, the full crafting tree is available
Major Tuning Work - as always, feedback is needed! Item frequency, biome progression, stack sizes, crafting recipes - everything has been touched a bit.

The full change list is as follows:

(NEW FEATURE) Warm weather can now heat the player up at the same rate that cold weather cools the player
(NEW FEATURE) Raft inventory can be focused on while away from the raft, but items remain unusable
(NEW FEATURE) Raft impacts no longer can cause broken bones, can cause the loss of a random item
(NEW FEATURE) New conversation UI
(NEW FEATURE) New Biome progression: added more challenging biomes to endless progression
(NEW FEATURE) Make rags option: clothing items can be deconstructed to rags once a stone knife is held
(NEW FEATURE) Improved UI: Inventory now scrolls to focused item
(NEW FEATURE) Fires no longer cause burns: blocking capsule added to lit fires
(NEW FEATURE) Engine upgrade to UE 4.9.2
(NEW FEATURE) Consume stack option: stacks of items can be consumed at once
(NEW FEATURE) Added Workbenches - located at Hardware Store & Gas Station Locations
(NEW FEATURE) Added Wasteland Biome
(NEW FEATURE) Added UI elements for Gas when motor upgrade is installed
(NEW FEATURE) Added UI alerts for raft upgrade state changes: water collector, stove, gas
(NEW FEATURE) Added tiny scratches affliction from brambles
(NEW FEATURE) Added some location specific loot boxes
(NEW FEATURE) Added particle FX when looting on the river
(NEW FEATURE) Added new hazards: brambles, poison ivy
(NEW FEATURE) Added many contextual tutorial hints
(NEW FEATURE) Added location specific information when docking
(NEW FEATURE) Added feather item: shoo crows to produce feathers
(NEW FEATURE) Added Craftable Fires
(NEW FEATURE) Added Bow & Arrow
(NEW FEATURE) Added blood spurts on arrow hit, spear trap hit
(NEW FEATURE) Added Biome Names with biome information
(TUNING) updated many crafting costs for various items
(TUNING) stack sizes for many items increased
(TUNING) item frequency increased for many item types (lumber, saplings)
(TUNING) Global temperature tuning pass
(TUNING) Changed raft damage calculation: Damage now based on speed and angle of impact
(BUG FIX) Added ability to leave pause menu with ESC key
(BUG FIX) Reduced efficacy of tainted meat: only attracts 1 wolf, only can be eaten once
(BUG FIX) Increased chance of encountering Magnolia NPC at gas station locations
(BUG FIX) Fixed mouse/keyboard input on loot containers
(BUG FIX) Fixed marina bug where UI would not update quickly enough when upgrades were applied
(BUG FIX) Fixed jar light on wake from sleep
(BUG FIX) Fixed issue with Temperature: air temp now affects the player’s body temp
(BUG FIX) Fixed issue with some blurry item icons
(BUG FIX) Fixed issue with blurry textures on road pieces
(BUG FIX) Fixed issue with bait becoming uncollectible if collection was attempted with a full inventory
(BUG FIX) Fixed issue where water collector would stop functioning after save restore
(BUG FIX) Endless Mode games no longer give the “high ground” campaign quest
(BUG FIX) Changed rain timer to reset on biome transitions
(BUG FIX) Added full controller support for the options screen

If you encounter any issues or bugs, please let us know in our discussions.

About This Game

A rogue-lite river journey through the backwaters of a forgotten post-societal America. Forage, craft, evade predators.

From the Art Director of BioShock and a team of veterans of the BioShock, Halo, Guitar Hero and Rock Band series comes The Flame in the Flood.

Travel by foot and by raft down a procedurally-generated river as you scrounge for resources, craft tools, remedy afflictions, evade the vicious wildlife, and most importantly, stay ahead of the coming rains.
READ MORE

System Requirements

Windows
Mac OS X
    Minimum:
    • OS: Windows 7 64 bit (requires 64 bit OS)
    • Processor: Dual Core Processor, 2.5 GHz or higher
    • Memory: 4 GB RAM
    • Graphics: DX11 compatible video card
    • DirectX: Version 11
    • Hard Drive: 2 GB available space
    • Additional Notes: These requirements are subject to change as we complete development
    Minimum:
    • OS: 10.9.2
    • Processor: Dual Core Processor, 2.5 GHz or higher
    • Memory: 4 GB RAM
    • Graphics: Dedicated Video Card (Intel integrated GPUs are not supported)
    • Hard Drive: 2 GB available space
    • Additional Notes: These requirements are subject to change as we complete development

Posted: October 12
Early Access Review
One hour in and im already hooked
Fun survival game with excellent music really cool art style and a nice crafting system
Right now there is not a campaign just survival mode but for now that's good enough for me

The more i play this game the more i fall in love with it..it's cruel and unforgiving which is what keeps bringing me back. one minute your doing well, you have extra water filters lots of food, life is great. next thing you know you get jumped by a wolf and get a laceration . then all of a sudden it's like damn maybe i should have crafted a bandage nah i'll just try to find a fish string to craft a stiching kit. then in your rush to scavenge stop to stop for a fishing string you forget about your food levels..no problem i'll just stop at the next place and find food..that's when the next 3 places you try to stop at you are greated by wolves:) and they don't seem to want to let you get food..then you slowly die of starvation floating down the river...goodbye cruel world game over.

Early Access Review
The Flame in the Flood is a GREAT adventure that goes PLAYED and LIVED!
Let's start from the excellent soundtrack, to his world "devastated" where you have to resist as much as possible.
I noticed several small bug, but considering that it's a game under development, we can move on!

In short, The Flame in the Flood is a game done well, thanks to its mechanical manages to offer several hours of play!

(Below is the Italian full review)

Dal direttore artistico di BioShock e altri membri del team: Halo, Guitar Hero e Rock Band arriva The Flame in the Flood.

Viaggia attraverso un mondo fantasiosio insieme al tuo fidato cane, con la zattera lungo un fiume che si genera gradualmente, trova o costruisci oggetti per resistere alle tempeste, trova del cibo o medicazioni... The Flame in the Flood è un'avventura magica dove bisogna sopravvivvoere, o meglio VIVERE il più lungo possibile!


Feature:

- Stile artistico completamente lodevole

- Prova molte sensazioni dalla felicità alla paura

- Il modo cambia in base alle scelte che facciamo e si genera gradualmente

- Costruisci e trova miglia oggetti

- Supporto Completo al Gamepad


Parere Personale:

The Flame in the Flood è una GRANDE avventura che va GIOCATA e VISSUTA!
Cominciamo dalla ottima soundtrack, al suo mondo "devastato" dove bisogna resiste il più possibile.
Ho notato vari piccoli bug, ma considerando che si tratta di un gioco in fase di sviluppo, ci possiamo passare sopra!

Insomma, The Flame in the Flood è un gioco fatto bene, che grazie alle sue meccaniche riesce a offrirti varie ore di gioco!

Posted: October 9
Early Access Review
Flame in the Flood - A Steam Review

[Disclamer - I was provided a copy of by the publisher for review purposes]

The good
  • Extremely addictive
  • Cute graphics

The not so good:
  • Way too addictive

The conclusion:
Usually I don’t have a lot of patience for roguelikes but Flame in the Flood crept up on me and, before I knew it, I had 4 hours of playtime (planning on many, many more!).
You wake up, a dog drags you to the raft, and then you sail down a river, stopping for supplies and crafting materials on different islands. The idea is to go farther and farther and get better equipment along the way.

Unfortunately, this is about survival and the system is really well done, so you’re gonna need to eat, drink and sleep constantly ...and take care of yourself. If you die, it’s back at square 1. I somehow managed to have 2 broken legs, some intestinal parasites and the flu before I died eaten by a wolf. Normally something like that would discourage me for a bit but I dove back in immediately, just to see how far I could go before my character keeled over from exhaustion.

Very enjoyable experience, well worth the money even though it’s not even fully released.
Watch me drink contaminated water here :

Posted: October 12
Early Access Review
This is one of those games that takes you a few good tries to actually get the hang of it. My first hour or two was me dying day 1 either by infections and being mauled. However I'm now on day 55 and gone downstream 70 something miles and have almost all the raft upgrades and loaded with food and etc. It's good, especially for a beta game, but I do hope they update it because again, there are bugs still. The only bad thing about this game is the rafting controls, it does get better if you are able to make a rudder, but its still not a walk in the park...you can barely touch something and the raft flies in the air and you have 2 broken bones...other than that it is a great story, great music, great gameplay, most of it is easy to control, but most importantly it has a dog that looks like he has sunglasses on B)
